"Hey Brendan! And I assume you're Edward?" she asked.

"Yeah, and you're Beth, right?"

"Mmm-hmm!"

Beth and Edward shook hands.

"I've heard, well, SOME about you Edward." Beth said.

"Yeah, I, uhh, would say the same." Edward replied.

"Sorry you guys don't know a whole lot, I guess I am not used to...talking about my friends." Brendan said, feeling a bit guilty that they were more-or-less strangers to each other.

"Don't worry! That just means we can get to know each other face-to-face!" Edward said.

"So, uhh, what DO you know about me Edward? I know that you and Brendan kinda met by chance, you protect him from bullies, and you've told him about the same kinds of stuff I told him about his, as he calls it, 'wimpiness'." Beth said.

"Oh, well I know you met when you saved him from being mugged, you're the first person who ever looked out for him, and you've told him about the same kinds of stuff I told him about his, as he calls it, 'wimpiness'." Edward replied.

Beth flicked a part of her long black hair over her shoulders and smiled at Brendan, and almost sounding like she was bragging, asked "So he didn't tell you about what I look like or any of my...talents?"

Edward ran his hands through his spiked brown hair and grinned at Brendan. "Nope, and the same goes for you, right?"

"Mmm-hmm! I didn't know you were such a prettyboy with an incredible smile."

"Haha! And I didn't know you were such a, well...tall with long hair?"

"Go ahead, I'm not ashamed, I am fat!" Beth proudly said, putting her hands on her stomach.

"Hey, its great that you're confident and comfortable about that."

"Its not just me, my family is too, except for my little sister. And there is something else we have in common!"

"Yeah, whats that?"

Beth smiled and slowly leaned forward and elevated her large butt off the bench.

BBBBBBBBLLLLLLPPPPPPPPPVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTT!!!!!

Beth blasted a bubbly fart that went into a very loud, sharp ripper. Her skirt, as it usually did, fluttered in her breeze, and the force was strong enough to burn the bushes behind her to shriveled crisps, and uproot a couple of large trees like they were weeds.

"And that STILL wasn't my best one!" she said with a wink as she sat back down.

Brendan was still shocked at how strong her farts were, and the fact that someone had farts that were superhuman in the first place!

Edward was shocked too with his eyes almost bulging out of his head. He just stared at Beth for a moment in silence.

"Wow Edward, not even Brendan was in that much shock from my display!" Beth said with a giggle.

"Thats...not why I'm shocked Beth!" he said.

"Huh? Then why?"

"Oh just THIS..."

Edward, with an even bigger smile than usual, closed his eyes and...did nothing?

No, the wilting plants and dried-up grass around them did indicate he was doing something, and a couple of large trees decaying into mulch-like piles indicated it was something strong.

Edward opened his eyes and glanced over at Brendan and Beth. The large girl was wide-eyed and very impressed because she knew what had just happened, but Brendan didn't quite realize.

Then the smell suddenly hit him like a pile of bricks.

"Guh! Ugh! Edward!!" he exclaimed, rubbing his stinging and watering eyes, hunching over and trying to hold his breath to keep himself from collapsing.

"Thats one heck of a toxic fart Edward, I am VERY impressed! I didn't know anyone outside my family and neighbors could DO that!" Beth said in surprise and excitement.

"Thanks Beth, I'm very happy with my skill. Beats both my athletics and my looks, and it makes the best and most entertaining repellent or knock-out gas when I need to use it that way!" Edward said happily.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendan has Edward and Beth meet.

choices: Beth and Edward have a fart contest.
Cut to how Brendan met Corey.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Brendan could feel himself about to black out, so he reached up and managed to grab onto the strap of Beth's tank top to get her attention.

"Brendan!" Beth grabbed him and hugged him tightly, burying his face in her chest and belly. This wasn't the first time she had done this, and as humiliating and pathetic as it made Brendan feel, it was the best and quickest thing she could do.

Edward looked a little uncomfortable as well. "Should I...should I not BE-?"

Beth had a feeling what he was getting it. "Its nothing like that! Its kind of a...shield or an airbag or a-"

"A gas mask?"

"Yes! I could always blow your smell away I guess, but I-"

Edward laughed playfully at this. "My gas can not just be blown away. It sticks around for a long time, and no fans or windows will be any help! The only thing that helps get rid of it is if I wave it away, and me only." The photogenic boy did so for the benefit of Brendan's breathing, although some of his stench still stuck at their surroundings.

Brendan could be heard saying something muffled, so Beth released her grip on him and he collapsed back onto the spot between his friends. Both his cheeks and his eyes were red, and for entirely separate reasons.

"I said how is that even possible?!" he exclaimed as he gasped in (not so) fresh air.

"What is?" Edward asked incredulously.

"ALL of that! You just killed plant life and made trees melt! With-with Beth, I mean, it makes more sense, but not a whole lot, because its almost like a...tornado blowing out of her butt, I guess."

Beth giggled and blushed at Brendan's analogy.

"But Edward, yours isn't like that. It just smells horrible! And-and nobody will see it coming until it starts, uhh, peeling wallpaper or-or melting metal, but they'll, I guess smell it not soon after THAT!" he continued.

"Thats what they call 'silent but deadly', my friend, and its what I'm best at! And I have actually done those things quite a few times, Brendan!" Edward boasted, smiling and nodding slowly.

"I know what that is, but these are, uhh, almost literal! How can a bad smell wilt plantlife or melt stuff?! That does't make sense is all!"

"You're right, bad smells doing that DOESN'T make sense, it takes the strength bubbling inside of you, literally, and how you let it all out!" Beth happily explained.

"So it has not just the gas itself alone, but...also the person who produces the gas and the way they...release it?" Brendan asked in confusion, surprise, and a little bit of disgust.

"Good! You've got it Brendan!" Edward happily exclaimed.

"You will have to meet my family, well, BOTH of you actually. I bet you guys will like them, and Brendan you'll see what we mean by the way we blast it affects what happens. The Blaster family sure has a way with farts!"

"I'd...love to meet them!" Brendan was certainly telling the truth when he said that, but he was a bit hesitant on doing that since he was still overwhelmed (in more than one sense) by all of this gas.

Edward and Beth could both tell this fact.

"Brendan, its not like you need to meet them right away. I'm just bringing it up because I'd love for you to, and even ignoring the gas or the weight, which are two things that can't really be done with the Blasters, I know you and Edward would like them!" Beth said.

"Yeah, uhh, Brendan, my...talent isn't going to ruin our friendship or anything, is it?" Edward worriedly asked.

"Of course not Edward! It'll take me some...getting used to, mostly in the physical sense, but I'm not going to stop being your friend for it!" Brendan assured him.

"Phew! What a relief! I figured that you would still stick around, but I just HAD to ask to be sure!"

"I do have to ask...why didn't you gas out any of those bullies?"

"Oh I had every urge to Brendan, believe me! I didn't want to subject you to my toxic farts on top of you just getting bullied. I wanted to avoid adding insult to injury, or I guess depending on the bully, insult to insult! Also, I wasn't sure how you would react, at least not in the mental sense, since there aren't a lot of ways people can react to my farts if they somehow stay conscious!"

"Alright, that was, um, thoughtful of you then Edward."

"Of course, now that I know you are fine with it and can somewhat handle it, I don't need to worry!" Edward happily said, giving Brendan a goofy grin and shaking him a little.

Brendan managed to hide his despair and disgust at his friend's implications. Just because he didn't mind it, that doesn't mean he needed it! Beth could tell this by his slight change in expression, and giggled at the poor guy's amusingly unintentional and unfortunate torment.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: They save Brendan from the smell.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
About a month had passed since Brendan introduced Edward and Beth to each other. The three of them would hang together often, and while he had yet to meet Beth's family, they knew who Brendan was and understood why he was hesitant to see them.

On the side of Edward, Brendan was becoming a bit more resistant to his emissions, even if he still suffered and was exasperatedly disgusted by the prettyboy's power. At first Edward had only used it to subdue bullies, an event that was happening less and less often, but as he and Brendan became better friends, he often enjoyed pranking the poor blonde.

By this point, Brendan had noticed, like a guy with a weak poker face, Edward had a tell. Whenever he would smile out of the blue, that would indicate he was passing gas. Then again, it wasn't much of a tell in the poker sense, since Edward knew that Brendan recognized this, and its not like he wanted to hide that fact. THEN AGAIN, it wasn't really a warning either, because with a warning, you have time to get prepared, but in this case, it was too late to get away.

The two of them were walking through the hallway at the end of the school day when...

"UGGH! EDWARD!" Brendan exclaimed and shoved Edwards arm off of his shoulder. The prettyboy just nodded slowly and closed his eyes, having no shame about his emission and Brendan's reaction. Brendan's eyes stung from the smell and he covered his nose with his hands.

This wasn't the worst of Edward's gas, because he usually "held back" during school, unless it was against bullies, and mostly because he just wanted to prank Brendan and not the entire school, although he didn't exactly get upset if he saw people collapse on the ground or run away with their noses plugged. Also, his smell was still strong enough to slightly warp the paint and structure on lockers and discolor wallpaper, results which STILL didn't make sense to Brendan.

"Edward." Brendan groaned as his friend's smell seemed to follow them as they walked.

"Hey, I'm not emitting anything. I told you, my gas sticks around for awhile Brendan." Edward explained while pointing a declarative finger at him.

PLLLLBBBBBTTT!!

A loud sharp fart left Edward's butt.

"Edward!" exclaimed Brendan.

"Hey, I just told you Brendan, I'm not emitting anything. And my farts are silent killers, remember? Don't be embarrassed just because YOU let one slip! It happens to everybody, its just some peoples are more frequent and potent and on-cue! Unless you're trying to be like me, which is flattering, but just be you Brendan!" Edward said, starting out with an explanation with a (fake) serious look, into a silly ramble with a goofy grin.

PPPVVVVWWWWWTTT!

A sharp soft fart left Edward's, erm, Brendan's butt?

"Brendan, if you're trying to compete with me, you have to do better than that."

"It wasn't me!"

"So you think it was me? Brendan, I'll SHOW YOU me if you need a refresher!...Actually, a refresher around me wouldn't help."

"I'm-I'm not saying its you Edward!" Brendan was panicking a little, because he did NOT want his friend to give him "proof".

"Then admit you were the one who did! I'm not going to shame you for it Brendan, that would be hypocritial of me!"

"But it wasn't!"

Brendan and Edward didn't know that a bowl-cut brunette boy was hiding close by and snickering to himself.

Edward shrugged and closed his eyes. "Okay, if you won't owe up to it, then I'll guess we have to make it like it never had happened."

"What...do you mean by that?"

Edward had his trademarked smile again, "We've got to replace the smell, Brendan!"

Brendan was quick to object to this. "But there-there IS no sme-"

It was too late, Edward had already given the tell-tale sign. With a smile and closed eyes, he let it out. Brendan almost immediately fell on his hands and knees and started coughing and sobbing. Edward had the right opportunity to take his prank further since poor Brendan's face was about at level with his butt.

Does he take that opportunity though?
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Cut to how Brendan met Corey.

choices: Corey proves his talent through a direct demonstration.
Corey proves his talent through a fart contest with Edward.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
However, Edward thought that would be a bit much, and the gas was already lethal enough as it is.

Lockers groaned and creaked as the metal warped and rust started to appear, the ceiling lights started shorting out, and wallpaper pretty much burned up right from the walls. Edward, still smiling but stopped smelling, observed the collateral damage dealt by the pure odor of his SBD. He looked down at Brendan, who was pretty much collapsed to the ground, and decided to get him some (very) fresh air.

Quite easily, he threw Brendan over one of his shoulders and walked briskly outside and put him against a large (and still intact) tree at the park. (And yes, this was the same park AGAIN.)

Brendan was conscious, but he wasn't fully aware of what happened.

"Oh, you're not knocked out! Nice job Brendan!" Edward said to him cheerfully.

"Ed-Edward?! Did you bring me here?"

"Of course I did! You literally fell to the floor from my last fart, which wreaked complete havoc on the hallway, so I brought you here to the park!"

Brendan sat up, "Havoc? Like, from the smell?"

"Of course! The lockers were rusting up, the wallpaper was burning down, and the lights were shorting out!"

Brendan got to his feet and was still confused by the results of Edward's gas. "That...HOW?! Smell can't age metal, strip walling, or damage wiring!"

Edward rested his arm on Brendan's shoulder again. "Well it did, Brendan!" he cheerfully replied.

The bowl-cut boy who was hiding earlier was running up to them. "Hey! You two guys! Mind if I talk to ya?!"

"Um, uh, okay." Brendan said, finding it kind of odd some dude would come up to them out of nowhere.

"Yeah, sure, whats up?" Edward said, not minding the random encounter.

"Remember those small farts from before that neither of you took credit for?" he asked.

"Um, I, yeah." Brendan blushed a little, not realizing someone other than Edward knew about it.

"Well you both were right! Neither of you did it, because it was me, COREY THE FARTRILOQUIST!" he boasted like an announcer, complete with waving his hands out.

Brendan was totally lost. "...Huh?"

Edward was rather confused too. "So you're Corey, but what is a fartriloquist?"

"A fartriloquist is an individual who has the talent of, in a way, 'throwing' their farts so it sounds like someone else was responsible, resulting in amusingly awkward situations!" Corey explained in the same boasting tone of voice.

"So its sort of a prank? Like what I do to Brendan here?" Edward asked, shaking Brendan slightly, who groaned a little.

"Precisely!"

"Doesn't...doesn't telling us...take away the, um, credit of doing that? Or-or something like that?" Brendan asked.

"Why ordinarily, yes! However, I revealed this to you because of what your friend Edward had demonstrated! That fart, why just by smell alone, it was able to wreak havoc on the hallway and almost knock you out cold!"

"Haha, thanks for that, Corey! I had just told Brendan the same thing!" Edward excitedly stated.

"I...I guess being a, um, fartriloquist makes you...immune to Edward's toxins?" asked Brendan.

"Why yes, but I also have comparable flatulence to his. However, if I go all-out on it, it would expose me as the fartriloquist during my acts!" explained Corey.

"So...you have superhuman and destructive farts too?" Brendan asked dreadfully.

"That is correct Brendan! Would you like a demonstration?"

"N-no! No! I believe you, Corey, I believe you!" Brendan quickly said.

"Well I don't believe you. I'll bet you just have average farts that you just use for your fartriloquist act." Edward said, trying his best to keep a straight face.

Brendan cringed, since it was obvious what he was trying to do.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: No

choices: Edward, Brendan, and Corey decide to meet up with Beth too.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"Very well, I shall prove to you my true talent! Step away from the tree please." Corey said, and Edward gladly did so. Brendan groaned again, really not wanting to, but trudged over to Edward's side anyway.

Corey stood against the tree, and put on a look of concentration. His eyes were shut so tight that his eyebrows looked like they were stuck to his lids, he had a serious grimace, and his face turned an ever so slight shade of pink.

PPPPWWWWWWVVVVVVVVVVVVEEEEEEEEEEVVVVVVVVVVVBBBBBBBBTTTT!!!!

Corey ripped a very loud sharp fart that caused the (rather large, mind you) tree to esentially explode into burnt splinters, and the smell and strength of the fart killed all of the grass in a wide radius around the charred stump and almost blew Brendan over.

Corey looked at them with a curious look and a raised eyebrow, wanting their opinions.

Edward grinned and applauded, and Brendan was in shock and confusion as he usually was after a display of supernatural fart power.

"So, would my performance earn me a spot on your cast?" Corey asked.

"If-if you're asking if we'll be your friends, then of course! And its not like something you need to audition for!" Brendan cheerfully exclaimed.

"Brendan's right, you don't need to impress us to be friends with us." added Edward.

Corey put his hands in his pockets and shrugged. "I know, I know, and even if I never bothered to open up to people about my wonderful talent, I still know. Its just the way I talk, thats all."

"So why...DO you talk like that anyway?" asked Brendan.

"Why because I have the desire to become an actor! It doesn't have to involve my flatulent talent, although that would certainly be ideal, I just wish to play a role of some sorts and become famous for it!" Corey boomed, waving his arms and motioning like he usually does when talking as such.

"Thats a great dream to have Corey!"

Edward smiled and nodded, "Yep, and based on your...dramatic displays, I believe you're well on your way to becoming a star!"

"Why thanks you two! I can already see that we are going to be very good friends!" Corey said.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Corey proves his talent through a direct demons...

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"And it goes without saying that Corey was absolutely right about that." concluded Brendan.

"Hey these are cool stories and all, but we have a contest here, remember?" Cassie said impatiently.

Jackson rolled his eyes. "Yeesh, is the contest all you guys can think about?"

"Yeah, I like learning these things about our friends! And Brendan hasn't gotten to how he met me, Jackie, and big bro Brad yet!" added Annabelle, although she wasn't annoyed about it like her boyfriend was.

"I understand how they are. They aren't here to listen to the script, they are here to audition for the part! Hearing Brendan's story was enough for me, so the next contestant can go now." Corey said.

"I will." Cassie said. She stepped forward while Corey and Edward went back to the others.

Poor Brendan whimpered a little as Cassie bent over with her giant jeans-covered ass aimed right at his face.

Cassie looked over at Brendan and grinned, "Sorry Brendan, but if I wanna beat my twin sister, I gotta blast it right where she did!"

BBBBLLLLPPPPPPPPOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVBBBBBBBBBBBVVVVVVVVVFFFF FFFFFFFFFPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPTTTTTTTTTTTTTT!!!!!

Cassie released a massive fart that sounded like a tuba mixed with a space shuttle taking off! Like an earthquake in all but name, the entire mall shook and swayed violently; the large girl was really putting the structure to the test.

Then the ground behind the fountain actually started to crack and split open like a canyon! The cracks spread all the way down the hallway and stopped at the opposite wall of the mall. Any shops and stalls set up along the middle of the hall would've been sucked into the drop had they not exploded into pieces first. Everyone should count themselves lucky that nobody fell in.

Even though this fartquake was strong, it wasn't forceful enough to blow any of the judges backward (again, counting themselves lucky), nor did it leave a terrible stench (although it wasn't exactly smell-free either).

Cassie turned around and smiled proudly at her display of strength. The judges were rattled and dizzy from the pretty much natural disaster she caused, and took a moment or two to regain their composure.

"Wow! Did that fart register on the richter scale or something?!" Jackson exclaimed.

"I'd bet you could split the entire Earth in half if you felt like it!" Annabelle exclaimed.

"Just...watch your step everybody." Brendan said. Even after all of this time, it still made absolutely no sense to him how farts could cause so much damage.

"You might have actually topped me with that one Cassie." Beth admitted.

"Definitely beats MINE." Lucy said, feeling a bit envious.

Who is up next?
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendan's story is over.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"I'll go next, if thats alright with everyone." Trevor said.

Brendan, Jackson, and Annabelle made plenty of room as the gargantuan gassy geek turned around and sat his massive posterior on the foutain. The already damaged marble cracked and chipped under Trevor's weight, and the judges were sure it was fianlly going to collapse.

Trevor put an arm around Brendan and pulled him right next to him, causing Brendan to sink into his body blubber a bit.

"I forgot about Trevor's Jupiter gravity." the blonde moaned.

"His what?" Jackson asked.

"And what does Jupiter mean with that?" Annabelle asked.

"Trevor is very...personal, and its probably because he's a big huge softie...in more ways than one, so if you're his friend and you're next to him, you're gonna get...pulled in...and then comes the gas giant." poor Brendan groaned.

"Oh, well in that case!" Jackson hurriedly switched spots with Annabelle so he would be the one more affected by Trevor's "gravity".

"Aww! Jackie! You didn't need to switch with me!" Annabelle said sweetly.

"I know Annie, but if there is a choice on which one of us suffers less, I'll give that to you!" Jackson said, pretending to sound noble and brave as Trevor pulled them closer to him too.

"That is weird...but definitely hilarious. I'll bet he's a real gas giant." commented Cassie.

"You won't be disappointed, let me tell you!" Dobbs said.

BBBBBBBLLLLLLLLLLLPPPPPPPPPPBBBBBBBBBBBPPPPPPPPPPPPBBBBBBBBBBBLLLLLLLLPPPPPP PPPPPPPPBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPBBBBBBBBBBBLLLLLLBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB BTTTT!!!

Trevor grinned as he let out a very low-pitched, very long, bubbly fart. His huge ass, as well as the entire mall, vibrated violently from the frequent flatulence frequency.

"Mmmph!" poor Brendan sobbed as he tried futility to wriggle free from Trevor's weightly grip, but was forced to inhale the terrible stink from the "gas giant".

"Ugh! Damn! Annabelle, you're VERY lucky I switched spots with you!" Jackson told his girlfriend as he recoiled from the smell.

"It smells really bad from here still Jackie, so it must be really toxic from where YOU are!" Annabelle replied, wincing.

Trevor just giggled at their reactions and kept on farting. (All in good fun, of course!)

Unlike the other noxious emissions, Trevor's gas didn't have any adverse effects on anything but the nostrils of the judges he had a hold of. (not that his farts weren't capable of such feats of course!)

Brendan managed to rapidly slap part of Trevor's hand as if to say 'Uncle!'. Trevor got the message, and with a satisfied sigh, he at last stopped farting and let go of the coughing judges.

Trevor rested his hands on his huge stomach. "Ahhhhh, that was a decent out!"

"D-decent?!" Brendan exclaimed weakly.

"Yep, I didn't even damage the mall or anything, even with the smell."

"So nearly knocking us unconscious and pretty much forcing us to smell it up close wasn't enough?!" Jackson exclaimed as he gagged a little.

"I get why Brendan called you Jupiter now! Ugh!" Annabelle exclaimed, wiping the tears from her stinging eyes.

Trevor got up and Todd stepped up. "Thats a tough act to follow there Trevor!...And that is exactly what I wanted!" he said, crossing his arms with a confident smirk.

Brendan, Jackson, and Annabelle huddled back together and braced themselves. Todd doesn't take farts lightly and always feels like he has to one-up the previous emitter. If they knocked out a crowd of people, he would knock out a stadium of people!

Trevor turned around and pointed his camo-clad butt almost right up to the faces of the surprised judges. "You three are right to brace for impact! This gas is going to blow you away!"

PPPPPWWWWWWEEEEEEEEVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVEEEEEEEEEAAAAAAAAABBBBBBBBBBBBB BBBBBBBVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVBBBBBBBBTTTTTTTT!!!!!!

Todd ripped a massive and loud sharp fart. Not unlike Mathew, green puffy fumes were expelled from his ass, and these fumes eclipsed almost the entire mall! The hair and coats of the judges blew backward from the force and they scrunched their faces up.

Entire shops on the second floor started crashing through the ceiling behind them from the strength of Todd's fart, getting blown back and sucked into the huge canyon Cassie created, eventually burying it up to the top with rubble and junk. Somehow, someway, nobody was injured by the incident.

With huge gaps now in the ceiling, Todd's fumes rose upward, but the quantity was still so great that a cloud of fart gas hung almost right at the level of the top of the judge's heads.

"Hmph! Impressive, isn't it?" Todd smugly asked them. The wide-eyed judges nodded vigorously in response.

"Its just us two left. You wanna take this, sis?" Lucas asked Cortney.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Trevor

choices: Cortney destroys the mall with her powerful gas.
Cortney's gas mixes with Lucas's and Todd's, causing the mall to melt away.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"No way bro! I'm the grand finale here! The more time that has passed, the more time my passed gas has to load! I'm just savin' up here!" Cortney replied.

"Okay, but I'm not going for a win or anything, it doesn't bother me. I'm just here to bro out with my buds." Lucas said as he trudged over to the judges.

"Would you stop saying 'bro out', Lucas? Thats so dumb, not all of us are even guys here." Jackson said while rolling his eyes.

"Yeah, yeah, you keep telling me that its dumb. It doesn't bother me Jackson, I'm just gonna keep saying it."

Jackson scoffed, "Yeah, I know."

"Guess I'll gas you dudes now." Lucas still faced the judges, not even bothering to turn around.

PPPPVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVBBBTTTTT!!!!

A very long raspberry-like fart was let out by Lucas. Just like Todd before him, it was somehow visible. His gas was in the form of a green smog, which was slowly growing out from his butt and enveloping the clear air, and that included the area around the judges.

Unfortunately for them, like oil and water, Lucas's gas wasn't able to push through Todd's gas, who was very proud of that fact. It just created a lower area of green fog, and an upper area of green clouds.

Brendan, Jackson, and Annabelle covered their noses with their shirts and shut tight their eyes as they fell on their knees and coughed like mad. They had no means of escape from this smelly combination.

Lucas was rather surprised, "Whoa, looks like I did more good than I thought."

"Darn right Lucas, but I'm about to blow everything away! You judges better take cover, because Cortney's gonna blow!" Cortney proudly said as she stepped forward, smiled, turned around, and placed her hands on the sides of her large ass. Her stomach gurgled from the amount of gas that had been building up from the contest.

Brendan, Jackson, and Annabelle were not exactly in the position to do anything. All they could do was look at Cortney and her 'fart now loading' shirt in fear.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Lucas goes next.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
PPPPPLLLLRRRRRRBBBBBT! PPPPPLLLLWWWWWWRRRRREEEEEEEAAAAATTT!

fffffffwwwwwwssssssssfffffffwwwwwwwsssssfffffwwwwwssss

Cortney unleashed a lethal blast of gas from her deadly butt in the form of yellow-green puffy fumes. The force threw the judges clear across the hallway and they landed on the rubble caused from Todd's fart that was filling the canyon caused by Beth's fart. The cloud of gas left her butt and went into a long, loud, sharp fart while somehow emitting a sound similar to a tire deflating over and over again.

The gas came out in large bursts in timing of the "deflating" and the field of sight of the judges were obscured by Cortney's fumes, which easily overtook Lucas's and Todd's. Brendan, Jackson, and Annabelle were seeing exactly what she meant by comparing her butt to C4 earlier.

And C4 it was, because soon enough, the entire middle part of the mall collapsed in a heap of smelly rubble. By some miracle of a lifetime, nothing was hurt other than the nostrils and the dignity of the poor judges.

PPPPPBBBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRBBBBBBBBBBLLLLRRRRTTTBBBBBLLLLRRRRTTT!

fffffwwwwwwwsssssssfffffwwwwwwssssssffffwwwwsssss

And still Cortney farted, her gas going into a low-pitched bassy fart that continued on and made the judges teeter on the point of unconsciousness.

BBBBLLLLPPPPT!

At last she stopped with a small sharp fart. The entire mall was filled with the stench of her gas, as well as the sight.

"AAAAHHHHH! That felt good!" Cortney said with a grin, sighing loudly as she fanned away her fumes around her butt, which somehow began to clear up when she did. Despite having a huge opening to seep out to the rest of the world, her gas hung in the same area as it was emitted.

"You've done it again Cortney, wow!" Sadie said, giggling.

"Yeah sis, you pretty much blew up the building. Dang." Lucas said.

"Thanks ya guys, but I'm eager to know how the judges felt 'bout it!" Cortney turned around, and felt both pride and disappointment. "Aww shoot, my fart gas knocked 'em out cold!"

"How can you tell? I can't see anything through your clouds." Marcus said.

"Gusters can man, and Cortney is right." Lucas said.

"Well they did take over a dozen farts so that isn't surprising. Lets get them back to our place then." Brad said.

---

Brendan, Annabelle, and Jackson woke up on one of the three-person couches back at the guys house. All of the others were waiting on them, and needless to say, that living room was packed pretty tight!

"So who was it this time?" Brendan asked. He had been KOed by his friends farts so many times that this was just a regular occurence to him.

"I did!" Cortney proudly said, patting her stomach. "Also, I covered the entire mall with my fart gas and caused the middle of it to done collapse!"

"Then you totally win." Annabelle said.

"Yeah, nice one Cortney." Jackson said.

"I'm just releived it is all over!" Brendan said and breathed a huge sigh of relief.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Cortney destroys the mall with her powerful gas.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
About a week later, Brendan, Annabelle, Lucy, Sadie, Cassie and the rest of the class were in homeroom.

Their teacher went to the front of the room and spoke up. "Attention class, we have a group of new students joining this school as of today. Welcome Lilly, Lora, and Samuel of the Oder family."

Lilly had black hair that was about a little past her neck with long bangs, wore glasses, and a turquoise shirt under a buttoned-up light-blue coat with long sleeves, and a long dark-blue dress.

Lora had long slightly-curly brown hair that went past her shoulders, wore a long-sleeved orange sweatshirt, and blue jeans.

Samuel was rather tall with a large gut, red curly hair that went down to a little past his ears, a slight beard, and a wide chin, and he wore dark-blue jeans and a baggy gray hoodie.

"Now then, who wants to volunteer to show them around?...Alright, Lora, you go with Cassie, the young lady with the black hair wearing the purple tank-top. Samuel, you go with Annabelle, the young lady with with the brown hair wearing the black vest. And Lilly..." the teacher could not spot any volunteers, so she just picked out Brendan. "Lilly, you go with...the young man with the blonde hair wearing the checkered jacket..." she was drawing a complete blank at Brendan's name. Brendan groaned a little and blushed from his lack of impact even on the teachers, and a few students snickered at this.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: About a week later...

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"That won't be necessary." a rather deadpan-sounding voice said, and a very tall woman walked into the classroom.

She looked almost like a person of royalty, had she not had a look of a complete lack of interest on her face. She had reddish-brown curly hair that went all the way down to her waist, wore a flowing white dress, a small silver tiara, and long white gloves.

"And who are you ma'am?" the teacher asked.

The woman groaned in frustration, as if explaining this was a chore. "I'm Melonie, personal guardian of the Oder children. I told the principal all of this, and he gave the okay signal and the like..."

"If you are their guardian, why does that require you to come to school with them, might I ask?"

"Well you already DID kind of ask...Well its what their mother wanted. She is busy with her job as a secret agent or something, and she just...loves her children and trusts me with them or something. They aren't ordinary kids, you get it? And I don't mean by them being rich, because both their mother and myself made damn well sure not to make them turn out spoiled and privileged."

"Erm, ma'am, you seem to be rather-"

"Ugh, I know exactly what you are going to say and I've heard this a thousand times! You think I hate what I do, don't you? After all, as a teacher, I'm SURE you know what its like doing a job you hate, huh? Welp, that isn't me! I care about the whole damn Oder family a whole damn lot! I also care about as much as you believing that about as much as I care about what Brendah pays me to look after them, and thats to say not a whole damn lot! Caring about your beliefs that is. Brendah pays me very well, but I couldn't care less if she payed me nothing at all! THAT is how much I love that family, get it?" rambled Melonie, drifting between snide and passion the whole way through.

Other than the Oder siblings, everyone in the classroom, including the teacher, was in uncomfortable silence. Melonie eyed Lilly, Lora, and Samuel for a moment and sighed.

"Alright, so this 'showing them around' thing I guess is good for them in order to make friends and get their bareings and whatever. I know Brendah would tell me something like that and whatever, so just do whatever that teacher told you about following some kid or something." Melonie told the Oder siblings, having a tone that talking about this was the most frustrating thing she ever had to do.

Saved by the bell, because all of the awkwardness was cut off by the signaling of their first class.

Brendan walked out with Lilly, Annabelle out with Samuel, and Cassie out with Lora. Melonie would usually keep her eyes on them from a distance or just straight-up butt in whatever they were doing, but each of the Oder siblings were going to a separate classroom. The redheaded guardian just groaned loudly and started pacing through the hallways.

What duo does the story follow first?
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Someone else new shows up.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"Excuse me, I didn't catch your name." Lilly said to Brendan. She had a rather calm and quiet voice.

Brendan blushed a little and groaned, "Thats because my name wasn't given out...The teacher forgot it...Its Brendan."

"Don't worry, its nothing to be upset over, Brendan. People have lapses in judgment and memory sometimes, and it can come at critical times."

"Lilly, its more than that...It wasn't because the teacher forgot, well, it WAS, but there is a REASON she forgot...You see, I don't stand out. At all...The only thing I stand out is as a target, well, thats how I used to stand out, but that doesn't happen much anymore. Now I don't stand out AT ALL, so that makes me...forgettable."

"Oh Brendan, that is truly awful. Do you wish to stand out?"

"Not...so much. I'd rather be forgettable than be a target, and I don't need to be noticed by everyone. Guess you could say I resigned to my fate, huh? Of course, I've got quite a few friends now, and thats good enough for me, really."

"But its clear that it isn't good enough for you since you were so affected by your teacher forgetting your name."

"Of course it affects me, but its something I'm used to and its something I accept. I'm not some nobody, but I don't care if I'm not some somebody either. A couple years back, this would've really got to me, but thanks to all the friends I now have, I'm fine with being forgettable by the average person I don't even know."

"Your attitude and outlook on your position is very peculiar, Brendan. It is as if you are content on where you are at, but at the same time you dread it. Two clashing attitudes, Brendan, very peculiar indeed."

"Oh, um, well...Speaking of attitudes, can I just say, um, that...princess lady who looks out for you guys...uhh, she is...she seems very..."

Lilly giggled as Brendan stumbled with his words, and amused by his (understandable) impression of Melonie. "I understand why Melonie would leave a bad impression on you Brendan. Her personality clashes with how people perceive her based on her appearance and occupation, and that puts people off. However, just remember that everything she had said about my family is a fact. She does deeply care about us, and she has her own way of showing it."

"Oh, well as long as she really truly cares about you guys, I guess it doesn't matter if she is a little...abrasive with other people, I guess..."

"Now if we could backtrack the conversation a bit, exactly what did you mean when you labeled yourself a 'target'?"

"Huh? Oh, I-I mean a target for...bullying because of how...wimpy I am." Brendan explained while blushing.

Lilly stopped in her tracks. "I assumed as much, but I needed confirmation first."

"Uhh, Lilly, are you alright?"

"I should be asking YOU that question Brendan. Tell me Brendan, what is the frequency of your bullying?" Lilly's tone shifted to a more matter-of-fact tone.

"I, uhh, maybe about, two or three times a month tops?"

Lilly marched up to him and got hin his face. "You let me know when it happens and I will show up to save you from that foe!"

"Huh?! Like a bodyguard or something? Lilly, I don't need you to do that."

"Is it because I am female? I've got a very special power, I can handle it!"
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendan and Lilly

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"Huh?! No, its nothing like that! Even if I was shallow like that, I've been emasculated so much that I wouldn't be bothered if a BABY fought my battles for me!...Y-you know, if it effectively COULD...What I meant before was I don't need you to do that because I already HAVE a bodyguard. He's my best friend Edward!" Brendan explained.

"...Oh, well that makes perfect sense. I apologize for my outburst." Lilly replied, going back to her more quiet tone. She noticed Corey strolling up to them with his hands in his pockets. "Is that him approaching us?"

"Oh, thats Corey, my other best friend! Hey Corey!"

"Hey Brendan." he replied with a high-five. "Whose she?"

"My name's Lilly Oder. My family just moved here." she said, bowing.

"Well hello there Lilly, I am Corey, or as I was known formerly COREY THE FARTRILOQUIST! Normally I keep my previous role a secret to someone I had just been introduced to, but since you have connections with my buddy Brendan here, I gave you some insider information!" Corey said in his announcer voice.

Lilly was understandably confused. "I'm...not quite sure what you mean Corey."

Brendan smiled and shook his head a little at his friends "act". "Corey likes to talk like an actor sometimes because thats his dream, so if he is bellowing or using strange terms, thats why."

"What an interesting personality trait to have...There is still the question of his, as he referred to it as, his 'previous role'..."

"You mean my role as a Fartriloquist?" Corey asked.

"Exactly. I'm not familiar with that term."

"A fartriloquist is someone with the talent to effectively 'throw' their farts to make it seem like someone else dealt it. Great for pranks, but not so great for your true talent. You must hold back on your gas, because if you put too much power into it, it gives away the true culprit."

Lilly was intrigued by his usage of the word 'power'. "You say 'power', now what does that mean?"

"OH! Well my true talent is possessing superpowered farts! I'm talking window-shattering, earth-shaking, unconcious-causing blasts! And that talent isn't mine alone! The majority of mine and Brendan's friends have it! However, none of them besides myself desire to use it for fame!"

Lilly gasped, but didn't look completely surprised. "I should have expected this. That is why we moved here in the first place." she said to herself.

"Wait, what?" Brendan said.

"Oh, she's just talking about this citys reputation." Corey casually said.

"Wait, what?!"

"This city developed a reputation for many of its citizens having supernatural and destructive flatulence." explained Lilly.

"And also being rather, well, heavy for a lot of them, but that part applies to most places in this country." added Corey.

Brendan was floored by this information. "WAIT, WHAT?!"

"Brendan, you seriously didn't know that?!"

"No! Not at all!"

"Why do you think most of your friends fit that criteria then?!"

"I don't know! Just a really weird series of coincidences!"

"Just going by your roomies alone Brendan, that is 9 of them, and 4 of those 9 have some pounds on them, and you really believed all of that was just a coincidence?!"

"Yes Corey, I did! If this reputation was true, then how come I didn't even meet any of them until Beth 3 years ago?! I've lived here my whole life!"

"And I moved here less than that amount of time, but even I knew that Brendan!"

"How is all of that possible?!"

"Likely, as you have said before, you do not stand out, nor do you desire to stand out. Thus, you must have not noticed any of it, and since you were born here, you must have not been aware of how this city is viewed by the general populace. It comes down to mere ignorance Brendan." Lilly deducted.

Brendan blushed and groaned loudly upon this information and analysis, feeling even more of what little dignity he had stripped away.

"Don't worry Brendan, I'm sure most of our friends know that fact about you." Corey said.

All that did was made Brendan blush more and feel even worse. "Saying 'don't worry' like that doesn't help! Its like what Mathew says when he stinks up the house or the bus or the mall or something!"

"How about in the context of 'don't worry, we don't think any less of you because you didn't know something. Not knowing things does not mean you are unintelligent, it just means you weren't aware of the facts.'" Lilly said.

"That...kind of helps, yeah. I still feel stupid for not- Hold on, Lilly, does this mean you and your family have...?"

"Of course. Our last name sounds like 'odor' for a reason, Brendan."

"Awesome! Would you demonstrate your talent for us?" Corey asked.

"I would be delighted to Corey." Lilly said with a smile.

What 'power' does Lilly use?
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendan explains himself.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Lilly pointed her butt at some lockers, "Corrosive Fart Fog." she said as if she was casting some sort of magic. A green smog left her butt and grew all around the lockers behind her. The lockers started to rapidly rust, creak, and warp as they melted right off the walls into a thick grey puddle of smell as if a waterfall of acid had been splashed on them. The barren wall where the lockers were was slowly burning away as if it was as flammable as paper.

Lilly performed a curtsy, which somehow faded the fart gas, and looked at Corey and Brendan.

"Excellent audition Lilly! Bravo!" Corey exclaimed with an applause.

"Thank you Corey. And you Brendan?"

As usual, Brendan couldn't understand how any of that was possible. "I...that doesn't...how did you...?"

"Brendan's confused because our superpowered talent makes no sense to him." Corey said.

"Magical powers aren't going to make sense Brendan. Thats why its magic and not science!" Lilly explained with a wink.

This didn't remedy Brendan's confusion. "...Huh?!"

"Oh, I apologize Brendan. I like to, well, imagine myself as a...magical flatulence girl sometimes. That sounds illogical, I know, but its enjoyable to me. Thats partly why I wanted to be your bodyguard Brendan, and also why I said Corrosive Fart Fog before passing wind..." Lilly explained, blushing in embarrassment from this reveal.

"I think thats brilliant Lilly! I love it! Its just like me with my actor act!" Corey exclaimed.

"I don't see a problem with it either." Brendan said.

"Thanks you guys. I'm relieved that you accept that trait of mine." Lilly said with a smile.

"So Magical Flatulence Girl Lilly is practicing her powers again, huh?" Melonie said, trudging over to them and looking at the melted goo the lockers had been reduced to from Lilly.

"...Yes, I...wanted to show my new friends is all..." Lilly said nervously.

Melonie looked over at Brendan with her usual dull look. "Hey blonde kid whose name his teacher couldn't be bothered to remember, make sure you treat Lilly with kindness and respect. I don't care if her whole magical girl thing sounds ridiculous to you, you keep that to yourself. You ridicule her, and I'll ridicule YOU! And if you thought I layed into your teacher there, that was nothing compared to if you mess with these kids! I might even let Lilly bring the punishment, and I don't think you want to be on the receiving end of a...of a...Nuclear Butt Bomb...or-or something..."

The woman's wordy warning made Brendan wildly weary. "I..um, I was, I would never think to, I mean Lilly-!"

"Melonie, Brendan has treated me with the utmost kindness, as has his friend Corey there. They accept that trait of mine and don't bring me down in the slightest!" Lilly explained.

"...Alright, that checks out then. Hope you meet more people like Corey and Brandon around here then." Melonie said before walking off.

"Its...its Brendan, not Brandon..." Brendan said bashfully with a blush.

"Melonie is fully aware of your name, Brendan. She is just, well, talking down to you a little. Please don't take it personally, she speaks that way to most people." Lilly explained.

Brendan sighed. "Its alright, I'm...used to it, Lilly."

Which group does the story go to next?
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Corrosive Fart Fog

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
In another part of the school, Annabelle and Samuel were walking together.

"Samuel, you are going to LOVE IT here! Well, not at the school, because school is school, but the people AT the school! Well, not just people AT the school because a lot of my friends don't go to this school, but people at this CITY!" Annabelle rambled.

"Hehheh, I know what this place is known for, so I believe you on that one! My family relocated here for that very reason!" Samuel said.

"Wait...what do you mean you 'relocated here'?"

Samuel gasped a little and pulled up his hood, realizing he revealed something. "Oh, I uhh, we just moved here, thats it."

Annabelle became suspicious. "Wait on a second! Now Jackie may call me a ditz sometimes, but I can tell you are trying to hide something!"

"I am, thats why I can't tell you."

"Does it have something to do with your mom being a secret agent?"

"Shh! What makes you think THAT?!" Samuel whispered loudly.

"Melonie let it slip back in homeroom!"

"Thats-thats just Melonie going on and on about stuff! She makes things up about people a lot!"

"Samuellllll! Why are you trying to hide something from meeeeeee?!" Annabelle whined.

"Because its important info and stuff, and also, no offense Annabelle, but we JUST met, and I can't tell that kind of stuff to someone I barely know, again, no offense."

Annabelle continued to whine. "Awwww, but Samuelllllll! I wanted to be frieeeeeeends! I feel we can make a special connection this waaaaaaay!"

"...Wow, really? Some great big fat guy you were randomly assigned to, and you want to be close friends with?!"

"Yes! Just because I'm cute doesn't mean I'm shallow!...Or-or vain, even though I called myself cute..."
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Samuel and Annabelle

choices: Samuel shows what he can do.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Samuel sighed and put down his hood. "Alright Annabelle, I'll tell you, but you have to keep it between me and you, okay?"

"Yeah! Yeah! My lips are sealed! I won't even tell Jackie or big bro Brad!"

Samuel pulled her in close and whispered, "Okay, our mom is a very skilled secret agent who only needs her powerful farts to succeed! I know that sounds dumb, but its true! Anyway, we have to move around a lot so we don't get tracked and put in danger. She knew this wasn't healthy for her kids, so we settled down here where we can, well, blend in better! Thats also why Melonie is here, she is our special surrogate guardian while our mom is away, and she really cares about all of us even if she comes off as kind of...harsh."

"Wow Samuel, that is so incredibly amazing! I swear I won't say a word, but I wanna know, since you said your mom has powerful farts, does that mean you and your sisters do?!"

"Hehheh, you bet Annabelle! You wanna see what mine can do?"

"Of course!"
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Samuel tells her.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Students in the hallway behind Samuel were coughing, gagging, screaming, running, and collapsing from the smell that was spreading across the entire hall.

"Wow, was that an SBD?!" Annabelle said.

"Oh that wasn't me Annabelle. Besides, mine are anything BUT silent!"

"That was ME." Brad proudly stated as he walked up to them. He had his arm around the side of Jackson's head, which was pressed up against the side of his waist. Poor Jackson was limping and coughing from being so close-up to Brad's big butt, and he was finally released from Brad's grip.

"Jackie! Big bro Brad!" Annabelle happily exclaimed and hugged them both.

"Hey Annie!" Jackson said.

"Sup little sis?" Brad said.

"What happened back there?" Samuel asked.

"Cropdusting. Its when you fart and walk away. Its really funny to do in a small hallway with no air ventilation." Brad proudly explained.

"And when you are forced right next to the blast zone, its...potent!" Jackson added, cringing a little.

"Well I'm impressed! My names Samuel. My family just relo- I mean, moved here, and Annabelle is showing me around." Samuel said.

"Cool! I'm Annabelle's boyfriend Jackson."

"And I'm her big bro Brad." Brad said.

"Big bro Brad, I think you're gonna really like Samuel! He is kind of a lot like you!" Annabelle said excitedly.

"If Brad is a lot like him, then that is more than 'kind of', Annabelle." Jackson corrected.

"Oh you know what I mean Jackie!"

"Yeah, quit teasing my little sister or I'll pass gas again." Brad warned.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Someone else shows up.

choices: Brad wants to prove to Melonie his farts are powerful.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"Speaking of which, I never got to do that myself, Annabelle!" reminded Samuel.

"Oh yeah! Let it out Samuel!" Annabelle said.

Samuel stuck his butt out a little and did just that.

PPPPBBBBBBVVVTTTTT!!! PPPPPWWWWWWWRRRRRRRRRBBBBBBBBTTTTTTTT!!!!

A loud, slightly low-pitched fart followed by a very loud, very low-pitched, almost bassy fart blasted out of his butt in the form of a light-green puffy cloud of fart gas.

Samuel's fart quickly traveled all the way across the hallway, tearing apart bulletin boards on the walls, blowing doors off their hinges, turning lockers into smoldering piles of shrapnel, burning away any papers or books, and any students in the blast radius were flung all the way to the far wall and knocked out, provided that Brad's fart hadn't knocked them out first.

The redhead turned around and chuckled proudly at the damage he had dealt.

"Wow! Nice one!" Jackson said.

"Yeah, that was funny and really strong Samuel." Brad said.

"Oh my gosh Samuel, that was amazing!" Annabelle said.

"Thanks you guys, and that wasn't even my best one! I blew up an entire resort hotel with a pretty much nuclear fart of mine!" bragged Samuel.

"Thats really funny Samuel. I've passed some powerful gas as well, and I know Jackson and Annabelle can back me up on that." Brad replied.

"Yeah! Big bro Brad is incredible with his farts!" Annabelle said.

"Uh-huh, I've counted myself lucky to get out of there alive quite a few times around him!" Jackson said.

Melonie walked up to them from the opposite side of the hall that Samuel had spared. "I think everyone who has ever been around the Oders can obviously say that. That included myself for awhile until I got used to their nuclear farts."

"Hey there Melonie! Guess you're glad you weren't downwind from that one!" Samuel jokingly stated.

"Oh please Samuel, it don't matter if someone is upwind, downwind, sidewind, or abovewind from the family wind. You lot are like natural disasters or something." Melonie said with a very VERY small smirk.

"Hey I'm pretty deadly myself." Brad said, not wanting to be downplayed.

"Oh, yeah, sure, don't walk behind you after lunch, huh?" Melonie muttered, not caring.

"No, don't walk behind me AT ALL." corrected Brad.

"Unless he forces you to." Jackson exasperatedly added.

Melonie, again, didn't care. "So Samuel, are you WANTING to get expelled your first day here? You know covering for Oder damages isn't going to cut it for very long."

"I was just showing off to my new friends! But I guess I did go a LITTLE overboard." Samuel admitted.

"What an understatement. If you consider turning half of a hallway barren a LITTLE overboard, then what do you consider EXTREMELY overboard? Turning a city into a crater or something?"

"Samuel, can you really do that?!" Annabelle asked in both excitement and curiosity.

"Lets not give him any reason to try, sweet-pea." Melonie said sarcastically.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Samuel demonstrates his gas.

choices: Lora keeps lieing (or at least TRYING to!)
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
In another part of the school, Cassie and Lora were walking together.

"So how long have you guys been living here?" Cassie asked.

"Oh, umm, about a w-week." Lora replied, putting her hands on the sides of her stomach for a moment.

"What brought you guys here?"

"What br-brought us here? Umm, the, umm..." Lora stopped and clutched her stomach again.

"Uhh, are you feeling okay?" Cassie asked.

"F-fine! I'm just a little...nervous, thats all!" she replied, straining a little.

"Because its your first day at this school I bet, right? That will wear off faster than you think it will. And if it has to do with any punks bothering you, just show them whose boss and they'll avoid you!"

"No, I'm not...I'm not worried about-"

"I could do that for you if you want. My sisters boyfriends got a guy here for that, and I love having any reason to use my ASSets!" Cassie offered, proudly placing her hands on her large stomach.

Speaking of stomachs, Lora's was gurgling pretty audibly and violently, to the point where she had to hunch over a little and hold it.

"Okay, you're definitely not nervous, Lora. You're sick to your stomach, and it must've been something you ate because I haven't given you a reason to feel like that yet! And ESPECIALLY if it was from something that I ate!" Cassie said, half-bragging.

"Urrk!...Ugggh!...No Cassie, its...n-nothing! Please don't...ugh! W-worry!" Lora was really straining, and her stomach was sounding like really deep gurgling.

Cassie thought of something and smiled slyly. "Lora, you wouldn't happen to have...GAS would you?"

The accurate accusation really rumbled Lora. "What?! N-NO! Of-of course not! UGGGGRRRRGHHH!"

"Really? Because I bet its a powerful force of farts like my familys are. This city is famous for that, and I bet thats why your family moved here, right?" Cassie went on as she walked in front of Lora and turned away from her.

"No! We, urrrrg, we moved here because-because we, urrrggggggh!" Lora's stomach was now sounding like hard bubbles bursting and she was starting to sweat a little.

"Then why did you guys move here? Come on, you better tell me or else!" Cassie asked with a grin as she stuck her butt out a little. Lora, still hunched over, glanced up and was about eye-level with Cassie's colossal cannon.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Switch to Lora and Cassie.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Lora still wouldn't give Cassie the truth. "We-we moved here because-! Urk! We moved her because-! Uggh! We moved here be-because we-!"

PPPBBBRRRTT!

Cassie farted loudly for good measure, which blew Lora's hair back a little. Even though this was a small fart, it was enough that Lora couldn't hold it back any longer, and the brunette's fart was anything but small.

PPPPPPPPPPPBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBLLLLLLLLLLLLLBBBBBBBBBBBBPPPPPPPPPPPPP PPPPPPPPPPPPVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT!!!!!!!!!!

A gargantuan, extremely loud, and extremely strong blast of light-green gas blew out of Lora's butt as she blasted a massive low-pitched fart that echoed throughout the entire school!

If you thought Samuel cleared out the hallway behind him, he had nothing on Lora! The entire wing of the school behind her was completely demolished, as was every window, and chunks of the ceiling.

Any student or teacher who wasn't resistant was blown back and KOed in an instant! Even after her butt-blast stopped, the noxious cloud of gas hung around the entire school like a bubble with no sign of dispersing through the air.

Cassie was in complete and utter shock. This petite girls gas had dwarfed anything her big butt had unleashed (or at least for what she could remember). Lora, however, was standing there like she was about to burst into...
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Lora keeps lieing (or at least TRYING to!)

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Lora was red as a beet and about to burst into tears.

"Uh-oh." Cassie grabbed Lora and dragged her out the school where she found her sisters, Lora's siblings, Melonie, Corey, Edward, Brad, and other flatulence-resistant students (as well as their knocked-out friends) in a large group.

"Wow Lora, I'm really impressed!" Samuel exclaimed.

"I am also. Even unintentionally, you were able to unleash a Building-Breaking Butt-Bomb." Lilly added. Brendan was partly over one of her shoulders and partly over one of Corey's.

"For being such a scrawny so-called 'wimp', Brendan is shockingly heavy." Corey groaned.

"Hey, don't talk about him being heavy. I'm the one thats heavy." Cassie said, patting her large stomach.

"But your heaviness isn't surprising. Just like mine is, but I'd rather be called fat." Brad said to her, and he had both Annabelle and Jackson draped over his shoulders.

Lucy, Beth, Lucas, Sadie, and Cortney joined up with them.

"Whoever did this, I wanna shake their hand!" Lucy exclaimed.

"Oh I hear ya Lucy! This is the kind of fart I'll unload in a crowded department store while waiting in line!" Cortney bragged.

"Wait, so none of you guys did that?" Lucas asked.

"I wont ever take credit for someone elses display of proud flatulence." Sadie said with a shrug.

"Well theres no way it could have possibly come from the young lady frozen and red, thats for sure." Melonie said sarcastically as she shoved through the crowd and walked up to Lora.

Lora slowly lifted her head to look at Melonie with tears streaming down her face.

"Mmm-hmm, and I thought your brother was the one dealing the collateral damage." the tall woman said seemingly-unsympathetically.

"And I thought I was the one who was too harsh." Cassie muttered with a scowl.

Lora finally burst into tears. Melonie sighed a little, knelt down due to her tall frame, and hugged the brunette tightly.

"Alright, alright, take it easy. I will admit, I would rather see you be loud and proud instead of ashamed and embarrassed. You did quite a number on the school, and I'd hate to admit it, that really impresses me. For some reason, I think your mother would be proud of how strong that was. I guess its because she often has to, I don't know, destroy hideouts or melt strongholds or something. Its like her gas is a swiss-army knife, except much more dangerous, and its incredibley obvious you kids take after her." Melonie consoled, even if her slightly uninterested tone didn't give off the vibe.

This actually made Lora feel a lot better. "Thank you Melonie." she said, letting go and wiping the tears from her eyes.

"Thats how I'd rather see your eyes, Lora: Dried." Melonie said, standing up and nodding once.

"Did...that make sense to any of you?" Lucas asked. His sisters shook their heads.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Tears

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
When Brendan finally gained consciousness, he was laying against Beth's stomach with Edward sitting next to him. He was shocked to find himself in a very fancy mansion. He was on a white couch that was comfortable and finely-crafted, a couch across from him, a glass table between them, and one couch on each end of the table. The same arrangement was across the room from him.

The floor was polished and made from marble, as were large pillars with fake vines wrapped around them that were holding up the sides of the second floor that was accessed with a wide staircase in the middle of the room. A red carpet led from the staircase to the large double-doors.

Cassie, Lucy, and Corey were on the couch on his left, Brad, Jackson, and Annabelle were on the couch at his right, and Lilly, Lora, and Samuel were on the couch across from him with Melonie leaning forward against the back of it.

"Boy, Lora did a number on YOU, Brandon. The little couple over there came to about 10 minutes ago." Melonie explained in her uncaring tone of voice.

"I figured my body would be used to being knocked out from farts by now, but I guess not...Hold on, where am I?" Brendan asked.

"You're at the Oder residence, kid."

"Yeah, we wanted our new friends to come visit!" Samuel said.

"THEY wanted THEIR new friends to come visit. Not me. You all barely know each other so it seems like a bad idea to me, but who am I to ever let my feelings get in the way of these three kids?" Melonie stated.

"Come on now Melonie, be a little nicer to our guests." a womans voice said from the stairs.

The Oder siblings gasped and turned to face the voice, they knew it was their mother Brendah.

Brendah was quite a hefty woman who had brown hair that went a little past her shoulders, short statue, rather wide, had plump lips and slightly chubby cheeks, wore a grey sweatshirt, a black wool cap, and black sweatpants that covered her wide posterior.

"Mom!" her children exclaimed in unison as she came down the stairs and up to them.

"Hey you three! I sure have missed you!" Brendah hugged all 3 of her children, being wide and chubby enough to embrace them all at the same time, even Samuel!

Melonie gave the woman a little wave. "Brendah." was all she had to say.

"Oh Melonie, come on up here you!" Brendah said playfully with a big grin.

Melonie rolled her eyes a little, knowing exactly what was coming next, and sat on one of the sofa arms. Brendah wrapped her arms around Melonie's middle and pulled her off the sofa arm for a hug. The tall woman's lower body was just kind of draped on the floor due to the large height difference between her and Brendah.

Melonie groaned slightly as she sunk a little into Brendah's fat with her chin pressed against her broad shoulder. Melonie being herself, she never actually hugged back, but Brendah's hug was more than enough for the both of them anyway.

"Just please don't fart, we have guests." Melonie groaned. Melonie being herself, she didn't actually care about Brendah being "polite" or the guests being blasted, but just used them as an excuse so she wouldn't be gassed-out herself.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Later that day...

choices: Someone passes gas to lighten the mood.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"Oh!" Brendah finally let Melonie free, who sat back down on the arm of the chair. The large woman turned around and greeted the guests. "Sorry for not acknowledging you kids before! I haven't seen Melonie or my own kids in awhile, and we aren't used to having visitors."

"Hey we get it Mrs. Odor, its alright." Jackson said casually.

Brendah playfully scoffed. "You kids can call me Brendah, I don't need those formalities! You're all friends of my kids, so we should know each other casually!"

Melonie sarcastically scoffed. "Friends? More like people from school the kids barely met."

Brendah turned back toward her family. "How WAS school for you three by the way?"

"Excellent! I got to know two very interesting classmates." Lilly said.

"And I met three really great and fun people!" Samuel said.

"Great news! And you Lora?" Brendah asked.

"Umm!" Lora looked down and blushed a little.

"Whats wrong sweetie?"

"She's upset because she accidentally almost destroyed the school with a fart." Melonie explained casually.

Lora flinched from Melonie's blunt statement.

Brendah put a hand on her daughters shoulder and smiled. "Oh sweetie don't worry! You know we can afford the damages and we will make damn sure nothing bad happens to you, alright? I know this has happened to you before, and I know how students might start treating you, but this city knows about that kind of stuff so its different here. Its only been one day and you already have a nice group of friends and I'll bet they, Samuel, Lilly, and Melonie will look out for you!"

"...I know, you're right, thanks mom." Lora said with a smile.

Cassie sighed. "Besides...it was kind of my fault that happened anyway."

Brendah turned towards the large girl. "Hmm?"

"Yeah...I figured out she was holding back her powerful gas and I kind of...pressured her into letting it out...I didn't know she had that much held in."

Lora's mother walked over to Cassie and looked her in the eyes, which made her feel a little uncomfortable. "So you were the one who made my daughter unleash a school-demolishing blast?"

"...Y-yes."

Brendah's serious look turned into a big grin. "Well thank you! Lora usually goes months without farting at school, and you managed to get it out of her on the first day! She should feel at least a little more comfortable about her power now! And speaking of power, that wasn't her holding in gas for a long time, her gas is just naturally that strong!" she then whispered to Cassie, but still loud enough for the others to hear, "I'm actually kind of proud of her! I can't say much, but I'm pretty building-blasting myself, and Lora is a natural at that!"

"Mom!" Lora exclaimed, embarrassed of her mother gushing about what she viewed as a shameful scenario.

"Is that because you blow up hideouts on your missions as a secret agent?!" Annabelle blurted out.

Everyone, especially Brad, Jackson, Samuel, and Melonie looked right at her.

"Shoot!" the brunette exclaimed, realizing she just announced a secret.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendah greets her guests.

choices: Brendah decides to pull one of them on Melonie right now.
Brendah wants to share a story.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
Melonie attempted to save face. "What in the world are you talking about, kid? Do you just go around making up dumb stories about people? If you are, at least try and make them A LITTLE believable. Nobody is going to buy the fact that some big, fat, gassy, giant girl is secret of ANYTHING!"

Annabelle realized what she was trying to do. "Sorry! I kind of have a habit of making up stories about people, right Jackie?"

Jackson didn't want to be caught into whatever was happening, but he had to back up his girlfriend on whatever this was. "To-totally! Annabelle is a little weird like that!"

"Now now, I get it. The beans got spilled, there is no denying it now." Brendah stated, sounding eerily calm.

"Aww, I like beans." Lucy quietly joked.

"It...was my fault mom, I said too much." Samuel said shamefully.

"I see...well you know what has to be done, right?" Brendah said.

"You gotta kill them all with a massive toxic ass-blast?" Melonie sarcastically guessed.

Brendah had to resist every urge to crack up. "N-no. We have to MOVE."

Lilly, Lora, and Samuel gasped and looked totally devastated and guilty.

"Boy that really sets the bar for the all-time Oder relocation record, now doesn't it?" Melonie muttered. The quick move didn't bother her personally, but she felt extremely bad for the Oders since things were just now starting to look up for them.

"...Another couch over here because there is no room here." Brendah finished, confusing everyone. "Samuel, would you please help me with that?"

Samuel slowly stood up and felt like this was some setup for some kind of punishment he was about to be dealt for saying too much. It only turned out to just be exactly what she said: Moving the couch from the other side of the room and putting it next to the one he and his siblings were at.

Samuel sat back down and Brendah sat on the empty couch. She looked at Melonie and tapped on the empty space on her left. The tall woman flashed a slightly pouty look; she definitely liked Brendah, but definitely didn't like being next to her. The large woman would just about always pull her in next to her, break wind, squish her, or what have you.

Whether it was Brendah's naturally playful, proud, and personal personality, if she just enjoyed messing with Melonie, or both was unclear to the princess-appearanced adult. Frankly, as she felt about most things, Melonie did not care.

Still, Melonie sat down next to her and kind of slumped down so they were both about head-level, and just as expected, Brendah wrapped an arm around her and pulled her up against her. Just as she usually did, Melonie groaned a little as she sunk a little into Brendah's fat. She groaned even more when she could hear the gas gurgling in the gargantuan girl's gut.

"Being pressed up against your fat, I can hear your butt-bombs brewing...Its like hearing the ocean with a seashell to your ear." moaned Melonie.

Brendah giggled, both at the analogy and making her abrasive friend suffer her pranks.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Things get awkward.

choices: Brendah decides to sit on Melonie as a prank.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"So since you all know my secret and we're all seated...Do you want to know more?" Brendah asked, surprising everyone.

Annabelle, along with a few of her friends, weren't sure if she was being serious or if this was some kind of test. "...Yes?"

"Great! I can't tell you much, but what I can tell you is about Melonie! I'm sure at least a couple of you are wondering how this whole situation with my family and her started!"

"Yes!" Brendan exclaimed. He blushed a little, not intending to sound that loud and eager.

"Well okay then! It was during one of my missions." began Brendah.

---

Brendah was sent out to rescue a woman of royalty who was kidnapped and held for ransom. She was being held up in a hideout made of thick metal hidden in the mountains. Trees and brush covered it up so it couldn't be seen, and the metal it was made of was special that it couldn't be found with radar or any other sort of technologically-enhanced vision. However, the agency she was a part of stumbled across it long ago and have been keeping their eyes on it for years.

This woman was locked up in a small, dark, and dirty metal room with her arms hooked onto short chains high up on the wall, forcing her to stand. A thick metal door was in front of her, and her back was right up against a large air vent in the wall. She didn't look sad, angry, or scared, but rather she looked tired and bored.

The metal door slid open, and she expected to see some goon to either interrogate her or force-feed her to keep her alive. To her (slight) surprise, it was a large woman, and the metal door slid closed behind her.

"Let me guess, you're on shift for checking on the little prisoner? Whats your torture method, you gonna sit on me?" the princess snidely stated.

Brendah grinned a little at the princess's surprising attitude and her suggested method of "torture".

The reddish-haired royal rolled her eyes as Brendah turned around. "Here it comes...Just for your benefit, if you're gonna sit on me, you're gonna have to unhook me too."

Brendah was doing just that, she placed her butt near one of the chains and...

ttttsssss!

With a "small" SBD that sounded like air being let out of a tire, the chain immediately crumbled into rust dust. The princess raised her brow a little, confused at what the weightly woman had just done. Brendah used the same flatulent freeing on the other chain and the princess immediately slumped down to the ground. She made sure to tilt her body so she wasn't in front of the vent.

"I would make a beeline for that door right now, but it feels too great to finally sit after all of this time. I'm sure you're about to do the same, BUT just for your benefit again, I have nothing you want. I'm not of royalty and you aren't getting any ransom money from the king or whatever you idiots expect to get out of me." the princess said.
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendah wants to share a story.

choices: The toxic gas. (and not the kind from Brendah!)
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"Don't worry, I was sent here by my agency to rescue you from here." Brendah said, smiling sweetly.

"...Just because YOU GUYS are stupid doesn't mean I'M stupid. Even if I were to buy the fact that someone so obese could EVER be some sort of secret agent, how could someone like YOU sneak in here undetected and then sneak out with their prisoner?"

Brendah wasn't in the least bit bothered by the princess's judgmental attitude. "But its more believable that I am a part of this gang?"

"Between the two? Yeah. Maybe you're like the crime lord's overweight daughter or something."

Brendah giggled at her straw-grasping guess, then smugly said "Whats your name, sweet-cheeks?"

"Melonie. How about YOUR name, stuffed-cheeks?"

"Melonie? A lovely name. I'm Brendah."

"Well unlike the majority of clothes in the world, thats something that fits ya."

Brendah laughed at Melonie's burn. "Good one Melonie! Be careful, that mouth of yours could really get you into trouble against someone with less humor than myself."

Melonie smiled a little, enjoying that this random woman was so relaxed and fun-loving. "How do you think I ended up here in the first place? Shooting your mouth off loses to shooting your gun off every single time."

Brendah smiled back, she could tell Melonie was warming up to her. "Come on, lets get out of this place."

"...How? Past that metal door is a long hallway with motion sensors that leads to another metal door. They'll know we're coming before we even get halfway there."

"Don't worry, we aren't going out that way anyway. I have a trap set up in that hallway in case anyone tries to get in here, and I don't want to put you through it."

"...Like explosives set up there?"

"Not quite explosives."

"...Like knock-out gas filled up there?"

"You could pretty much say that!" Brendah said with a huge grin.

"The only other exit is through that torture vent, and that is more like exiting your life than exiting this building."

"Well thats the way we're headed!"

"...Alright, even if you COULD get the thick metal cover off, you clearly didn't hear what I said when going through there will kill us."

"No, no, I heard you Melonie. If its the guards, don't worry, I can take care of them."

"I'm not worried about ANYONE here. I already said that I think they're idiots, and if they kill me for trying to escape, I knew that was possible before I even tried it. Killing me physically with a gun is better than killing me mentally with boredom and their stupidity like right now."

"Then...what ARE you worried about?"
1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.title: Brendah tells Melonie her mission.

1422222222222222222222222122122211222222.content:
"I wasn't chained up against the vent just because it was jagged and uncomfortable. They blast me with steam from that thing, and if you think its like a sauna, its not. The back half of my body from my neck down is probably well-done from all the cooking me like a lobster." Melonie explained.

"Oh you poor thing Melonie, thats terrible to hear!" Brendah said sincerely.

"I don't know, I applaud them for creativity at least."

"Don't worry Melonie, I can take care of the steam too."

"How? You gonna block it off with your fat?"

Brendah giggled once again at Melonie's snark. "Nope! But I've got a plan for that!"

Melonie stood up and walked over to the other side of the room. "...Okay, if you think you know what you're doing, who am I to tell you how to do your supposed-job?"

Brendah walked up to the vent, turned around, put her large butt up against the cover, looked at Melonie, and grinned. "Still don't believe me huh? I'll change your mind soon!"

tttttttttsssssssssssss!

The obese woman let out another SBD, which burned away the metal cover like some kind of acid. Melonie raised an eyebrow again, still confused on what Brendah had just did, but she didn't care enough to ask.

"Now come on." Brendah said as she got ready to crawl in.

"Just a few things before we continue this rescue mission. One, wouldn't it make more sense if I go before you? Two, you may be fat, but you aren't Santa Claus, there is no way you are going to fit through there. Three, even if you do, we aren't going to get to freedom through there like in some cheesy action movie. Four, even if we DO, we are still in the middle of nowhere and there will be goons going after us."

"Good questions Melonie! One, I need to lead the way, and there is nobody that will try to come at us from behind, believe me!
